SendRDComMail

SendRDComMail.Rd

The SendRDComMail function sends an email using the RDCOMCLIENT's Outlook service. It allows you to set recipients, CCs, subject, body, and optional attachments. Additionally, a flag can be set to mark the email for a reply. The function also includes a 5-second delay after sending each email to avoid rapid successive emails.

Usage

SendRDComMail(
  receiver,
  mail_cc,
  subject,
  mail_body = NULL,
  mail_attachment = NULL,
  flag = F
)

Arguments

receiver

A character vector of email addresses for the primary recipients of the email.

mail_cc

A character vector of email addresses for CC recipients. Defaults to an empty string if not specified.

subject

A character string specifying the subject of the email.

mail_body

A character string specifying the body of the email in HTML format. Defaults to NULL. If NULL, the email will only contain the default Outlook signature.

mail_attachment

A character vector containing file paths for attachments. Defaults to NULL, meaning no attachments are added.

flag

A logical value indicating whether to flag the email for reply. Defaults to FALSE.

Value

None. This function sends an email and does not return any value.

Details

  • Signature Inclusion: The email includes the default Outlook signature by appending it to the email body.

  • Attachments: You can include one or multiple attachments by providing a vector of file paths.

  • Delay: A delay of 5 seconds is added after sending the email to prevent excessive calls to the Outlook API.
